intro: Padus avium var. dolichocarpa, commonly known as the long-seeded bird cherry, is a variant of the bird cherry species native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–8 meters. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a drupe with a long, slender seed, distinguishing it from other varieties of Padus avium. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or open areas.
